question: Max Turns in Runner defines:
options: The maximum number of interactions allowed
The maximum screen brightness
The maximum battery charge
The maximum storage size

question: Why is Max Turns important?
options: It prevents agents from running endlessly
It increases hard disk size
It updates antivirus
It changes system wallpaper

question: If Max Turns is set to 3:
options: The agent stops after 3 exchanges
The laptop shuts down in 3 hours
The Wi-Fi disconnects 3 times
The screen flashes 3 times

question: Setting Max Turns too low may:
options: End the conversation before solving the task
Increase battery health
Install new drivers
Delete system files

question: Max Turns helps developers:
options: Control resource usage and prevent infinite loops
Upgrade Wi-Fi speed
Change screen resolution
Format hard drives

question: In Runner, Max Turns refers to:
options: The maximum number of conversational exchanges an agent can have
The maximum speed of the processor
The highest brightness level of the monitor
The number of Wi-Fi networks available

question: Why is Max Turns important in Runner?
options: It prevents infinite or excessively long conversations
It increases the storage capacity
It reduces system fan noise
It controls screen resolution

question: If Max Turns is set to 3, the agent will:
options: Stop after 3 exchanges with the user
Turn off after 3 minutes
Reset the computer after 3 updates
Send 3 notifications per hour

question: What happens if Max Turns is not set?
options: The conversation may continue indefinitely until stopped
The computer enters sleep mode automatically
The device lowers the volume to default
The operating system forces an update

question: A developer might lower Max Turns when:
options: They want the agent to stay concise and avoid long loops
They want to reduce battery usage of the device
They are adjusting the screenâ€™s refresh rate
They want to speed up system boot time

question: In Runner, the Max Turns parameter prevents:
options: Agents from entering infinite loops of self-calls
Agents from accessing system memory directly
APIs from generating duplicate JSON objects
Users from overriding default prompts

question: What happens if Max Turns is set too low?
options: Agent may terminate before completing a valid task
The CPU overheats
Output context becomes corrupted
Agent ignores the max token limit

question: Why is Max Turns crucial when agents interact with tools?
options: Because recursive tool calls can continue indefinitely without a limit
Because system prompts become invalid without it
Because API keys expire after too many calls
Because JSON formatting requires fixed boundaries

question: If Max Turns is exceeded, the default behavior is usually:
options: Terminate the agent loop with an error or safe return
Restart the runner automatically
Clear all context and reinitialize
Switch to a fallback model version

question: A developer should carefully tune Max Turns to balance:
options: Agent completeness vs. risk of infinite looping
Battery usage vs. memory allocation
Brightness vs. response latency
User input speed vs. API quota
